to_from:
-- a fresh variable with no category instance attached
@[simp]
theorem to_from (X : C') : fromShrinkHoms (toShrinkHoms X) = X :=
  rfl
#align to_from to_from

locally_small_congr:

    LocallySmall.{w} C â†” LocallySmall.{w} D := by

from_to:
@[simp]
theorem from_to (X : ShrinkHoms C') : toShrinkHoms (fromShrinkHoms X) = X :=
  rfl
#align from_to from_to

essentially_small_iff_of_thin:
/-- A thin category is essentially small if and only if the underlying type of its skeleton is small.
-/
theorem essentially_small_iff_of_thin {C : Type u} [Category.{v} C] [Quiver.IsThin C] :
    EssentiallySmall.{w} C â†” Small.{w} (Skeleton C) := by
  simp [essentially_small_iff, CategoryTheory.locallySmall_of_thin]
#align essentially_small_iff_of_thin essentially_small_iff_of_thin
essentially_small_iff:
/-- A category is essentially small if and only if
the underlying type of its skeleton (i.e. the "set" of isomorphism classes) is small,
and it is locally small.
-/
theorem essentially_small_iff (C : Type u) [Category.{v} C] :
    EssentiallySmall.{w} C â†” Small.{w} (Skeleton C) âˆ§ LocallySmall.{w} C :=
  by
  -- This theorem is the only bit of real work in this file.
  fconstructor
  Â· intro h
    fconstructor
    Â· rcases h with âŸ¨S, ğ’®, âŸ¨eâŸ©âŸ©
      skip
      refine' âŸ¨âŸ¨skeleton S, âŸ¨_âŸ©âŸ©âŸ©
      exact e.skeleton_equiv
    Â· skip
      infer_instance
  Â· rintro âŸ¨âŸ¨S, âŸ¨eâŸ©âŸ©, LâŸ©
    skip
    let e' := (shrink_homs.equivalence C).skeleton_equiv.symm
    refine' âŸ¨âŸ¨S, _, âŸ¨_âŸ©âŸ©âŸ©
    apply induced_category.category (e'.trans e).symm
    refine'
      (shrink_homs.equivalence C).trans
        ((skeleton_equivalence _).symm.trans (induced_functor (e'.trans e).symm).as_equivalence.symm)
#align essentially_small_iff essentially_small_iff

    EssentiallySmall.{w} C â†” EssentiallySmall.{w} D :=

  Â· rintro âŸ¨S, ğ’®, âŸ¨fâŸ©âŸ©
